tool.name: CoastalDEM
tool.summary:
Lowers the level of the sea to ensure it is always below land level. Also raises any land cells to 1 cm unless they are within a polygon with Land attribute of 0. The input polygons (LandSea) needs to identify the sea with a "Land" attribute of -1. Land is identified with a "Land" value of 1. No change polygons should have "Land" value of 0. This is commonly referred to as the Hawaii method.

Complete documentation can be found at XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX.

param.name: grdName
param.dialogReference: Raw DEM to be processed in the workspace specified above.

param.name: InFeatureClass
param.dialogReference:
Land-Sea feature polygon feature class. The "Land" attribute in this feature class should be populated as follows:

  • -1 - Sea or ocean, will be lowered to the Sea Level given below

  • 0 - Elevations in any area coded zero will not be changed. Use for true below sea-level areas.

  • 1 - Land areas. Any cells in these areas with elevation of 0 or lower will become +1.

param.name: OutRaster
param.dialogReference: Name of the output DEM. This will be used as the input DEM for hydro-enforcement.

param.name: seaLevel
param.dialogReference: The value to make sea/ocean areas. Default value is -60,000, which is lower than any streams should get burned. The units of sea level are the same as the vertical units in the input raw DEM.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Lowers the level of the sea to ensure it is always below land level. Also raises any land cells to 1 cm unless they are within a polygon with Land attribute of 0. The input polygons (LandSea) needs to identify the sea with a "Land" attribute of -1. Land is identified with a "Land" value of 1. No change polygons should have "Land" value of 0. This is commonly referred to as the Hawaii method.
